properties.displayName: [Preview]: Audit SSH Posture Control on Linux machines
properties.description: Requires that prerequisites are deployed to the policy assignment scope. For details, visit https://aka.ms/gcpol. Machines are non-compliant if SSH Server is not securely configured on the Linux machines.

configurationParameter.accessPermissionsForSshdConfig: Ensure that permissions on /etc/ssh/sshd_config are configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.ignoreHosts: Ensure that the SSH IgnoreRhosts is configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.logLevel: Ensure that the SSH LogLevel is configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.maxAuthTries: Ensure that the SSH MaxAuthTries is configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.allowUsers: Ensure that the allowed users for SSH access are configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.denyUsers: Ensure that the denied users for SSH are configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.allowGroups: Ensure that the allowed groups for SSH are configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.denyGroups: Ensure that the denied groups for SSH are configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.hostBasedAuthentication: Ensure that the SSH HostBasedAuthentication is configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.permitRootLogin: Ensure that the SSH PermitRootLogin is configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.permitEmptyPasswords: Ensure that the SSH PermitEmptyPasswords is configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.clientAliveCountMax: Ensure that the SSH ClientAliveCountMax is configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.clientAliveInterval: Ensure that the SSH ClientAliveInterval is configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.loginGraceTime: Ensure that the SSH LoginGraceTime is configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.messageAuthenticationCodeAlgorithms: Ensure that only approved MAC algorithms are used;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.banner: Ensure that the SSH warning banner is configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.permitUserEnvironment: Ensure that the SSH PermitUserEnvironment is configured;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.ciphers: Ensure that appropriate ciphers are used for SSH;DesiredObjectValue
configurationParameter.port: Ensure that the SSH port is configured;DesiredObjectValue

metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
Enable or disable the execution of this policy
File access permissions for /etc/ssh/sshd_config. Default is '600'
Whether to ignore per-user .rhosts and .shosts files during HostbasedAuthentication. Default is 'yes'
The verbosity level for the sshd logging. Default is 'INFO'
The maximum number of authentication attempts permitted per connection. Default is '6'
List of users to be allowed to connect with SSH. Default is all authenticated users ('*@*')
List of users to be denied to connect with SSH. Default is 'root'
List of user groups to be allowed to connect with SSH. Default is all groups ('*')
List of user groups to be denied to connect with SSH. Default is 'root'
Host-based authentication. Default is 'no'

metadata.displayName: Whether root can log in using ssh
metadata.description: Whether root can log in using ssh. Default is 'no'

metadata.displayName: Whether the server allows login to accounts with empty password strings
metadata.description: Whether the server allows login to accounts with empty password strings. Default is 'no'

metadata.displayName: The number of client alive messages which may be sent without sshd receiving any messages back from the client
metadata.description: The number of client alive messages which may be sent without sshd receiving any messages back from the client. Default is '0'

metadata.displayName: Timeout interval in seconds after which if no data has been received from the client, sshd will send a message to request a response
metadata.description: Timeout interval in seconds after which if no data has been received from the client, sshd will send a message to request a response. Default is  1 hour ('3600')

metadata.displayName: The time in seconds after which the server disconnects if the user has not successfully logged in
metadata.description: The time in seconds after which the server disconnects if the user has not successfully logged in. Default is 1 minute ('60')

metadata.displayName: The list of available message authentication code (MAC) algorithms
metadata.description: The list of available message authentication code (MAC) algorithms. Default is 'hmac-sha2-256,hmac-sha2-256-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-512,hmac-sha2-512-etm@openssh.com'

metadata.displayName: The contents of the banner file that is sent to the remote user before authentication is allowed
metadata.description:
The contents of the banner file that is sent to the remote user before authentication is allowed. Default is '#######################################################################

Authorized access only!

If you are not authorized to access or use this system, disconnect now!

#######################################################################
'

metadata.displayName: Whether ~/.ssh/environment and environment= options in ~/.ssh/authorized_keys are processed by sshd
metadata.description: Whether ~/.ssh/environment and environment= options in ~/.ssh/authorized_keys are processed by sshd. Default is 'no'
The list of allowed ciphers. Default is 'aes128-ctr,aes192-ctr,aes256-ctr'
The SSH port. Default is '22'
